item.title: City of Eagan WTF?
item.description: The City of Eagan blog, which generally seems to be a list of businesses, seems to have suddenly turned vicious. (via.)

item.title: Mankato discovers that the Internet
item.description: isn't always a very nice place.

item.title: Glad To See You Go
item.description: Yesterday's "What we miss" thread was a hit, so I'm wondering: what are some things that you're glad are no longer around the Twin Cities?

item.title: Hot Ink
item.description: Britt Aamodt offers a glimpse into a rich, whirlwind tour through our state's wealth of cartoon artists in what looks to be one of the MMAA's last exhibitions for a while, "Hot Ink: Comic Art in Minnesota."

item.title: Ur Lightrail is Sux0r
item.description:
Minnpost reports Dirty little secrets about light rail and a clean environment

"Far from protecting the environment, most rail transit lines use more energy per passenger mile, and many generate more greenhouse gasses, than the average passenger automobile,"

LRT, love it or leave it?

item.title: Powerline Takedown
item.description:
Lambert goes after the locally created political blog for claiming that Obama must learn to be as careful a public speaker as Bush: Hinderaker won The Golden Wingnut for this 2005 musing: "It must be very strange to be President Bush. A man of extraordinary vision and brilliance approaching to genius...."

Maybe Hinderaker was hoping for a sleepover with that last one, but my point here is that Hinderaker and the rest of his Powerline team truly are regarded as part of the intellectual foundation for 21st century conservatives. Hence the internecine warfare the Republicans are waging as we speak. How do you climb out of a hole dug by that kind of thinking if you depend on ... that kind of thinking ... to return you to the suirface?

item.title: Nobody walks
item.description: Bad times for Denny Hecker: The ubiquitous auto dealer also is expected to file for bankruptcy for some of his businesses as soon as this week.

item.title: Today's Wisconsin Ridiculousness
item.description:
Man Reports Burglary, Forgets To Hide Weed.
Superior Man Experiences The Thrill Of Collecting A Ball Of Twine.
Wausau Man Had BAC of 0.56% And Lived.

item.title: Design errors factor in bridge collapse
item.description:
According to the NTSB [via Salon.com]: "National Transportation Safety Board investigators said the bridge collapse was unavoidable once U-10 steel gusset plates failed. Investigators also ruled out any pre-existing cracking as a factor in the accident."

Are we to assume then that the additional equipment weight on the bridge, along with hot weather factors, contributed to the failure of the gusset plate?

item.title: Death and the Somali community
item.description: They came to escape civil war, so why are they killing each other in the streets?

item.title: Missing Twin Cities
item.description: What place, person, or things was once here, ain't no more, and now you miss it?
